events.name: GDG DEVFEST NAIROBI &CENTRAL

venue.name: Strathmore University
venue.address_1: Ole Sangale Road

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Joining thousands all over the world for the greatest series of DevFest events DevFest Nairobi and Central Google Developer Groups are coming together to have the biggest developer event of the year! aimed at familiarizing attendees (who are members of a variety of developer communities) with groundbreaking technology advancements. We will be working closely with Women Techmakers in this devfest season, to continue improving the diversity in our ecosystem.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam 2018

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
Bring your laptop charger.

The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Create a Qwiklabs account at https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! That makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

• Important to know
Come and learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. And Many more.... Looking forward to see you.

events.name: Hash Code 2018

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
• What we'll do
Hash Code 2018

Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a Google engineering problem for you to solve.
Are you up for the challenge?

You are required to register this Hub through the official website:
https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/

Stay tuned for more information.

GDG UoN is organizing a HUB where you can join with your team.

| Registration |

It is now possible to register your team for the HashCode 2018!
https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html
You need to register at the website and pick our hub to be able to attend this space. Don't stay at home, come solve with us!

More info coming up soon :

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

Come and learn new skills for a digital world. Learn how to grow your career at your own pace, with flexible and personalized training courses designed to build your confidence and help you thrive.

Come with your laptop, notebook, and an enthusiastic attitude.

venue.name: University of Nairobi

events.description:
For Bot services, assemble, interface, convey and oversee keen bots to connect normally with your clients on sites, applications, Facebook Messenger and much more.
Extract rich information from images to categorize and process visual data—and perform machine-assisted moderation of images to help curate your services using computer visions.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Essentials

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through 4 Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the cloud console, Kubernetes and Machine Learning.
Then after the meetup, you will have free access to 3 more labs you can finish at home. Complete all 7 labs and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Please share your excitement using the hashtag #CloudStudyJam19
events.how_to_find_us: Please make sure to carry your student ID (UoN students) or your national ID/passport. The venue is at the College of Biological and Physical Sciences; Chiromo campus. At the gate, ask for directions to SCI or C4D Lab.

events.description:
The Developer Student Clubs University of Nairobi chapter will be hosting its first info session this year on Wednesday, 2nd October, from 2pm to 4pm.

We will be introducing the club to new members, sharing tech journeys and most importantly explain how this Google program would benefit students in the University and the community at Large.

Join us this Wednesday for an interactive and networking session.
Tag along a friend not forgetting ENERGY!!!
See you then.

venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
This mentorship session courtesy is aimed at having students gain experience and confidence in personal and school life , identifying personal interests and goals , understand career options in ICT and identify future employment opportunities. Various invited speakers will cover the various mentioned topics.

You are all welcome!!

events.name: Android Fundamentals

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
This Wednesday, a reknown Android developer, Juma Allan will be facilitating an Android session at the school of Computing and informatics. He will take us through the basics of Android. He will cover a range of important topics, Java, Kotlin and all you need to know to start off as an Android Developer .
Come ready to learn new things as we help jumpstart you into mobile apps development.

Bring your laptop, tag along a friend and psyched up to end the year the Android way!!

events.name: #IamRemarkable

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
#IamRemarkable is a Google initiative empowering women and underrepresented groups to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond. This event will be a women-only event for this first round. We would like to start off the year with a ladies' event so that we can improve the self promotion motivation and skills of women and underrepresented groups.

Come and Get Motivated, Inspired ,connect with other ladies , share stories and find out how remarkable you are. In preparation to the event, you can take time to reflect on why you think you are remarkable. If you think you are not, then COME!!! and let's help each other find out how we are remarkable.

events.name: Solution Design Day

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
Developer Student Clubs (DSC) invites students to develop solutions for local community problems using one or more Google products or platforms. All DSC UoN members are invited to this Solution Design Day to get to understand how the Solution Challenge works as well as requirements. On this day, 25th January, we will have 3 sessions covering UI/UX, Design Thinking and Product Design.

We would recommend this as a MUST attend for those who are interested in participating in the challenge.

If you don't have an idea yet, don't worry, this will be a perfect opportunity to brainstorm!!

Let's come together and build solutions 🎉🎉😎

events.name: Web Development Series

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
This week and the coming weeks we'll be having project sprints as an approach to the web development series .
Every week or two we'll be implementing a core aspect of an app we'll be developing...

The app we have chosen for the next 3 weeks is an online food ordering service and this is the breakdown of how we will handle the sessions.

Week 1: UI
Week 2: API
Week 3: Hooking API to backend and authentication
Week 4: Hooking UI to API and deployment

If you are interested in web development, join us this Wednesday as we discuss on these sprints and how we can build applications on the web.

events.name: Mobile Development

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
We started off this track by an introduction to the Android Architecture. This Wednesday, we will go into exploring Android Studio and designing out first Layout in Android.

Join us on 5th February from 2 pm to 4pm as we continue our mobile Development journey.

Carry your laptop with you and make sure you have Android Studio installed.

See you then !!

events.name: Explore ML (Machine Learning) Beginner Workshop

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
Explore Machine Learning (ML) is a Google-sponsored program for university students to get started with Machine Learning. The curriculum offers 3 tracks of machine learning content (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced) .
Join us on 12th February as we explore Machine Learning starting off with the Beginner Track!

Why is Explore ML useful?
The biggest motivation is the acquisition of knowledge skills that will be valuable for your future.

Students who participate in the program will additionally:

Acquire foundational machine learning knowledge.
Build a network of like-minded, passionate students excited about applications of ML.

Please Fill this Pre-Survey Form to Find out what interests you:

http://www.google.com/url?q=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fexploreml-dsc-pws&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AFQjCNF_dH0fg3mu25yfPd9wMALiwAWGdA

Save The Date And Let us Explore ML

venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.name: [Joint Event] Firebase Study Jam

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

events.description:
======================================================================
This is a collaborative event with GDG Nairobi Community. Use this link to RSVP https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Nairobi/events/268320872/
======================================================================
Learn how to use Firebase. Firebase is app development platform that provides developers a variety of tools and a scalable infrastructure to build high quality apps. We’ll begin by showing how easy it is to read and write almost any data to Firebase and how to allow users to login, have data associated with them and send them notifications. We’ll learn how to use Firebase’s Security and Rules language to secure and add permissions to your data.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Don’t forget your charger!

group_profile.intro: My name is Caleb, Google Developers Group lead here in the University of Nairobi.
My name is Mercy, WTM -UoN lead,passionate about technology and community.
